strapiEdition.headline: Take One Down, Pass It Around

posts.title: New Tech Startup Moving to Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Cartwheel Startup Studio is bringing a fast-growing tech startup to Northwest Arkansas called Quantis — utilizing AI-integrated technologies for large-scale bottling operations.

Modernization: Based in Bentonville, Quantis, through its software platform Pocket Factory, aims to enable modernization and data-driven decision-making in food & beverage manufacturing facilities. This new technology company already has a multi-million dollar revenue stream and recently announced the highly accomplished Cate Gutowski as its CEO.

Strategic Partnerships: Cartwheel partnered with Strategic Systems International to build a company around the technology. As a result of the partnership, SSI plans to open an office in Northwest Arkansas by 2024.

Learn more about the exciting new startup HERE.

posts.title: Rogers Historical Museum Hosts New Program for Preschoolers
posts.content:
The Rogers Historical Museum and Rogers Public Library have partnered to provide an exciting new program for children ages 3-5 called Museum and Me.

Explore History: Each month features a themed story, crafts, and activities for preschool-aged kids. The series will begin with the theme Trains on Sep 12, followed by Toys on Oct 10, Fall on Nov 14, and Winter on Dec 12.

Learn & Grow: Join the free series and help foster your child’s interest in history, reading, and learning while engaging in hands-on activities and meeting others in the community.

There are only 20 spots available each month, so sign up today HERE.

posts.title: Fayetteville Planning Commission Approves Updated Plans for New Sports Park
posts.content:
The first of its kind for Northwest Arkansas, the proposed JJ's Sports Complex will provide training facilities for baseball, basketball, and even ninja obstacle sports.

Look Inside: The sports complex will include a 2-story, 59,502ft2 basketball gym, a 15,625ft2 baseball infield, two 9,900ft2 buildings for baseball hitting and pitching, and a 9,900ft2 ninja park located on 12 acres of land off of Van Asche Dr. near I-49.

Training Ground: Serving as a hub for competitive sports training for athletes of all ages, JJ’s Sports Complex will provide a place for athletes to train, develop, and build community in an exciting state-of-the-art facility.

Find more information in the Fayetteville Flyer HERE.

posts.title: Modernize Your Bathroom In As Little As Two Days
posts.content:
Add value to your home stress-free with help from Burnett Home Improvement — Northwest Arkansas’s reliable remodeler offering custom solutions based on your bathroom’s unique dimensions, individual aesthetic, and household needs.

Efficiency: Custom bathroom remodeling projects can take weeks and cost a small fortune. That’s why Burnett Home Improvement is proud of their efficient team and process to offer fully customized, lifetime-guaranteed bathroom renovations in as little as two days.

Quality: Whether you’re imagining a bath remodel, shower revamp, or a complete bath-to-shower conversion, Burnett Home Improvement can help bring your vision to life with a commitment to lasting quality and high efficiency — all at a surprisingly affordable price.

Begin your bathroom project with a free consultation HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• 🔎 College Clarity: Build student self-confidence in degree choice and guard against expensive 'switching majors' practices with the help of Lawson Coaching — a licensed administrator of the Highlands Career Assessment Test. CALL today 479-444-1400.*

  • 🎤 Steal the spotlight: Whether you're a shower singer or a seasoned performer, Big Box Karaoke is the perfect place to sing your heart out and make memories with friends.*

  • 😎 A Real Cool Guy: The Wall Street Journal highlighted Bentonville in a recent article, calling our small Ozarks city “a capital of cool.”

  • 🎨 Arts Destination: Eureka Springs was listed as the No. 1 Small Art Town in the U.S. by The Travel. See who else made the top ten HERE.

  • 🚗 Need for Speed: The NWA Corvette Club will host its Summer’s End Corvette Show this Saturday, Aug 26, at Pinnacle Hills Promenade, benefitting the NWA Food Bank and Altrusa International.

  • 📅 Ditch the FOMO: Post your upcoming events on our Events Page, and stay in the know about upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter.

  • 🥳 Join the Club: Our NWA Daily Fan Club keeps this thing going. In return for being awesome, they get access to exclusive giveaways — ranging from gift cards and concert tickets to bikes and kayaks!
